facts.fact_text: Total US consumer credit rose by $24.05 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Total US consumer credit rose by $24.05 billion in December 2025

facts.fact_text: The increase in consumer credit is equivalent to an increase of about 5.7% at an annual rate.

evidences.evidence_text: It is equivalent to an increase of about 5.7% at an annual rate.

facts.fact_text: Revolving credit increased by $13.85 billion in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Revolving credit increased by $13.85 billion in December

facts.fact_text: Nonrevolving credit rose $10.20 billion in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Nonrevolving credit, which includes auto and student loans, rose $10.20 billion in December

evidence.evidence_text: Total US consumer credit rose by $24.05 billion in December 2025, following an upwardly revised $4.70 billion gain in November and way above market expectations of an $8 billion increase.
